revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2020}} [[File:Nobel Prize.png|150 px|thumb|The Nobel Prize]] Since 1957, there have been thirteen [[Chinese people|Chinese]] (including Chinese-born) winners of the '''[[Nobel Prize]]'''. The Nobel Prize is a Sweden-based international monetary prize. The award was established by the 1895 will and estate of Swedish chemist and inventor [[Alfred Nobel]]. It was first awarded in [[Nobel Prize in Physics|Physics]], [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry|Chemistry]], [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]], [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]], and [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] in 1901. An associated prize, [[The Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel]], was instituted by [[Sveriges Riksbank|Sweden's central bank]] in 1968 and first awarded in 1969. Following is a list of [[Nobel laureates]] who have been citizens of the [[Republic of China (1912–1949)|Republic of China]] or the [[China|People's Republic of China]][http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/lists/all/ Chronological list of ''All Nobel Laureates'' on the official website of the Nobel Prize committee.] and of overseas birth. == Laureates == === Chinese citizens === ; Citizens of {{ROC}} The following are the Nobel laureates who are or were citizens of [[Republic of China]] (currently capital in [[Taipei City]]) at the time they were awarded the Nobel Prize.Country: China. [https://web.archive.org/web/20060709174912/http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1957/ Physics 1957 (by Internet Archive)] {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year!! |Laureate !! Chinese name !! English name !! Category !! Life !! Rationale !! Place of Birth |- | rowspan="2" |1957 | [[File:Yang.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh-Hant|楊振寧}}}} | [[Yang Chen-Ning]] | Physics | 1922– | rowspan="2" | "for their penetrating investigation of the so-called parity laws which has led to important discoveries regarding the elementary particles"{{cite web |url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1957/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Physics 1957 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[Hefei]], [[Anhwei]], China{{NoteTag|''Hofei, Anhwei,'' is now spelled ''[[Hefei]], [[Anhui]],'' using [[Hanyu Pinyin]] transliteration}} |- | [[File:TD_Lee.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh|李政道}}}} | [[Tsung-Dao Lee]] | Physics | 1926– |[[Shanghai]], China |- |1976 |[[File:Samuel ting 10-19-10.jpg|75px]] |{{nobr|{{lang|zh|丁肇中}}}} |[[Samuel C. C. Ting]] |Physics |1936– |"for pioneering work in the discovery of a heavy elementary particle of a new kind."{{cite web |url = https://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1976/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Physics 1976 |publisher = nobelprize.org |accessdate = 2009-10-09 }} |[[Ann Arbor, Michigan]], United States
[[Dual-citizen]] of {{Flag|United States}} and {{Flagicon|ROC}} [[Taiwan|Republic of China]] |- |1986 |[[File:Yuan T. Lee 1-1.jpg|75px]] |{{nobr|{{lang|zh-Hant|李遠哲}}}} |[[Yuan T. Lee]] |Chemistry |1936– |"for contributions concerning the dynamics of chemical elementary processes".{{cite web |title = The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1986 |website = Nobelprize.org |url = http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/1986/index.html |access-date = 2008-10-06 }} |[[Hsinchu|Shinchiku City]], [[Shinchiku Prefecture]], [[Taiwan under Japanese rule|Japanese Taiwan]]. |- |} ; Citizens of {{PRC}} The following are the Nobel laureates who were citizens of [[People's Republic of China]] at the time they were awarded the Nobel Prize.Country: China. [https://web.archive.org/web/20060709174912/http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1957/ Physics 1957 (by Internet Archive)] {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year!! Laureate !! Chinese name !! English name !! Category !! Life !! Rationale !! Place of Birth |- | 2010 | [[File:Liu Xiaobo.png|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh-Hans|刘晓波}}}} | [[Liu Xiaobo]] | Peace | 1955–2017 | "for his long and non-violent struggle for fundamental human rights in China".{{cite web |url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/2010/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Peace 2010 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[Changchun]], [[Jilin]], China |- | 2012 | [[File:MoYan_Hamburg_2008.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh|莫言}}}} | [[Mo Yan]] | Literature | 1955– | "who with hallucinatory realism merges folk tales, history and the contemporary".{{cite web |url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2012/ |title=The Nobel Prize in Literature 2012 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[Gaomi]], [[Shandong]], China |- | 2015 | [[File:Tu Youyou 5012-1-2015.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh|屠呦呦}}}} | [[Tu Youyou]] | Physiology or Medicine | 1930– | "for her discoveries concerning a novel therapy against Malaria".{{cite web |url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/2015/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 2015 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date =2015-10-05 }} |[[Ningbo]], [[Zhejiang]], China |- |} === Chinese diaspora === {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year!! |Laureate !! Chinese name !! English name !! Category !! Life !! Rationale !! Place of Birth{{NoteTag|The Nobel website lists the country of '''Residence at the time of the award''' for both the Literature and Peace (if goes to a person) prizes; see "Facts" information of the individuals at [https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/] and [https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/]. While the prizes for Physics, Chemistry, Physiology or Medicine, and Economic Sciences are listed by '''Affiliation at the time of the award'''; see "Facts" information of the individuals at [https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/], [https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/], [https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/], and [https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/economics/]. The official Nobel website only lists the country of the person's affiliated insititions for Physics, Chemistry, Physiology or Medicine, and Economic Sciences prizes, and not the citizenship of the person himself.|name=Nobel}} |- | 1976 |[[File:Samuel_ting_10-19-10.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh|丁肇中}}}} | [[Samuel C. C. Ting]] | Physics | 1936– |"for pioneering work in the discovery of a heavy elementary particle of a new kind"{{cite web |url = http://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1976/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Physics 1976 |publisher=Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[Ann Arbor]], [[Michigan]], United States[https://web.archive.org/web/20060718023001/http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1976/ Physics 1976 (by Internet Archive)] |- | 1997 |[[File:Professor_Steven_Chu_ForMemRS_headshot.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh|朱棣文}}}} | [[Steven Chu]] | Physics | 1948– | "for development of methods to cool and trap atoms with laser light".{{cite web |url = http://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1997/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Physics 1997 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[St. Louis]], [[Missouri]], United States[https://web.archive.org/web/20060718023001/http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1976/ Physics 1976 (by Internet Archive)] |- | 1998 | [[File:Daniel_Chee_Tsui.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh|崔琦}}}} | [[Daniel C. Tsui]] | Physics | 1939– |"for discovery of a new form of quantum fluid with fractionally charged excitations"{{cite web |url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1998/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Physics 1998 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[Pingdingshan]], [[Henan]], China |- | 2000 | [[File:Gao_Xingjian_Galerie_Simoncini_Luxembourg.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh|高行健}}}} | [[Gao Xingjian]] | Literature | 1940– | "for an œuvre of universal validity, bitter insights and linguistic ingenuity, which has opened new paths for the Chinese novel and drama".{{cite web |url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2000/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Literature 2000 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[Ganzhou]], [[Jiangxi]], China |- | 2008 |[[File:Roger_Tsien-press_conference_Dec_07th,_2008-2.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh-Hant|錢永健}}}} | [[Roger Y. Tsien]] | Chemistry | 1952–2016 | "for the discovery and development of the green fluorescent protein, GFP"{{cite web |url = http://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/2008/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2008 |publisher = Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], United States[https://web.archive.org/web/20060718023001/http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1976/ Physics 1976 (by Internet Archive)] |- | 2009 | [[File:Charles_K._Kao_cropped_2.jpg|75px]] | {{nobr|{{lang|zh-Hant|高錕}}}} | [[Charles K. Kao]] | Physics | 1933–2018 | "for groundbreaking achievements concerning the transmission of light in fibers for optical communication"{{cite web |url = https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/2009/ |title = The Nobel Prize in Physics 2009 |publisher=Nobel Foundation |access-date = 2015-09-22 }} |[[Shanghai]], China |- |} ==Others== ; Tibetan The following are the Nobel laureates who were uncertain citizenship at the time they were awarded the Nobel Prize. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year!! colspan="3" |Laureate !! Category !! Life !! Rationale !! Place of Birth |- |1989||[[File:Dalailama1_20121014_4639.jpg|75px]] |{{bo-textonly|བསྟན་འཛིན་རྒྱ་མཚོ་}} |[[14th Dalai Lama]] (Tenzin Gyatso)||Peace||1935–|| ||[[Taktser]], [[Qinghai]], China{{NoteTag|[http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1989/ The Nobel Peace Prize 1989] indicates Dalai Lama was born in [[Tibet]] in 1935. [[Taktser]] is a village located in [[Qinghai]] (spelled Tsinghai at the time), which was under the Nationalist Government of the [[Republic of China (1912–1949)|Republic of China]]. Although Tibet itself was not directly controlled by the Republic of China government, Tsinghai (Qinghai) province was under the authority of the government of the Republic of China.The Tsinghai Province was established as early as 1928, and Taktser since then has been a city within its region; see also the [http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:1930_Map_of_the_Republic_of_China.JPG 1930 national map of the Republic of China (ROC)], and the [http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:China_old_map_1936.jpg 1936 political regional map of the ROC] in [[Wikimedia Commons]].}} |- |} == See also == * [[List of Chinese people]] * [[List of Chinese scientists]] * [[List of black Nobel laureates]] * [[List of Latino and Hispanic Nobel laureates]] * [[List of Nobel laureates|List of Nobel Laureates]] == Notes == {{NoteFoot}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{-}} {{Nobel Prizes}} {{Ethnic Chinese Nobel laureates}} {{Nobel laureates of the People's Republic of China}} {{DEFAULTSORT:List of Chinese Nobel Laureates}} [[Category:Lists of Chinese people|Nobel]] [[Category:Chinese Nobel laureates|*]] [[Category:Han Chinese Nobel laureates|*]] [[Category:Taiwanese Nobel laureates|*]] [[Category:Nobel laureates of the People's Republic of China|*]] [[Category:Nobel laureates of the Republic of China|*]] [[Category:Lists of Nobel laureates by nationality|Chinese]]
